item.title: Storytelling with ggplot2
item.description: Loading data We have an important dataset on Attitudes towards Mental Illnesses, which is an interactive exploration of 2016 OSMI survey results. First we load the necessary packages: library(tidyverse) library(cowplot) library(gghighlight) library(knitr) library(MetBrewer) library(treemapify) Then we can load the dataset straight from the repository on github: data <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lescai-teaching/dataviz-rstudio/datasets/mental-heath-in-tech-2016_20161114.csv") We can now inspect what the dataset contains, by printing a table of its variables: kable(names(data)) x Are you self-employed?
